availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Thomas Dummit (Lewis County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Lewis County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Lewis County, Kentucky, native. Son of George Dummitt and Eliza Scott Dummitt. Married to Armilda Dummitt. Father of Eliza C. Dummitt. Resident of Greenup County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Lewis County in 1860. Served in the 45th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A) as a private from October 10, 1863 to December 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, First District, p. 233A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, p. 943.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, Laurel Precinct, p. 479B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0436.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 12027.
"William Thomas Dummitt (1841-1920)," Find A Grave, Memorial 119729647, accessed September 14, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/119729647.
